channel.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
channel.description:
I finished my client and source, uploaded client, and sent the link to my friend. He tried to play, and he said, he was getting the error 'Error connecting to server'. Yes, the 'gui' file has been changed to my server IP. Yes, I have no-ip... I tried to check with the status checker of Mopar and of another site which helps with RS...
So, I think it's an portforwarding error... Can someone tell me how to fix it?
TY!

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @kingtren kingtren
item.description:
@kingtren wrote:

Read my post You do not need Ipconfig your complicating things.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

On the computer where ipconfig didnt work type
cd C:\Windows\system32
than ipconfig.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @kingtren kingtren
item.description:
@kingtren wrote:

Here is whats wrong. You do not have a static Ip. To run a server You need a static Ip otherwise your Lan Ip is constantly changing. Wich in All common sense will never work with port forwarding. If you need help doing a static IP PM me otherwise, See if you cant find a tutorial.

To explain into detail. The computer that the Router is hardwired to has the lan address of 192.168.1.1 If you are on a wireless connection or not the primary connection your lan address will constantly change. so your address can be anywhere from 192.168.1.2 to 192.168.1.100 But you can change it so your computer never changes. So set it so your lan address will always be 192.168.1.2
Or just add my email for msn, Jonathanhubel28@msn.com If im online im more then happy to give a hand

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

You’re saying on the one computer IPCONFIG is not recognized?
If so, that I know I can fix.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Marcuum Marcuum
item.description:
@Marcuum wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:18, topic:347700”]On both computers, open CMD, and type ipconfig. The default gateway should be different from the TP-Link on one of the computers, use that default gateway to get to the site.[/quote]On this notebook, the CMD says ipconfig isn’t something intern… Well, it doens’t works.

On my room, it works, and the IP is 192.168.1.1. Read the pm I sent, it’s very important!

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

On both computers, open CMD, and type ipconfig. The default gateway should be different from the TP-Link on one of the computers, use that default gateway to get to the site.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Marcuum Marcuum
item.description:
@Marcuum wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:16, topic:347700”]http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/TP-Link/TL-WR541G/default.htm

http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/DSLink/220u-e/default.htm

Can’t really help past that point.[/quote]
I did what the TP-Link one said… The firewall thing too.

The DSlink one doesn’t help me since IDK how to get on it’s site, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Marcuum Marcuum
item.description:
@Marcuum wrote:

deathschaos9:

If you have two routers, you must portforward on both.(The destination IP may be different for both routers)

192.168.1.1 only redirects me to TP-Link one.

I have 2 comps here, one at my room uses the router (DSLINK), and the notebook (at my mom’s room) use TP-LINK.

Oh, and IDK the DSLINK (Router) IP/URL adress.

Ty Again bro!

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9

@deathschaos9 wrote:

If you have two routers, you must portforward on both.(The destination IP may be different for both routers)

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Marcuum Marcuum
item.description:
@Marcuum wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:12, topic:347700”][quote author=Marcuum link=topic=444085.msg3260729#msg3260729 date=1278467417]
I already opened the 43594 port on the firewall.

Still doesn’t work.

Icreated, if this isn’t hard, why didn’t you solved my problem yet? Hm…
[/quote]
www.portforward.com has all of the INFO you should need to portforward correctly. Portforward on the router giving your laptop the wireless, not both?
@death, I give up trying to help people…[/quote]
With my posts above, everyone can notice that this isn’t helping… I did everything right, and I’m sure because I already made one server, but I closed it, and I want to re open it now.

@Death, these are my infos.:

TP-Link WR541G/WR541G and DSLink 220E

TY DEATH.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:9, topic:347700”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=444085.msg3260721#msg3260721 date=1278467212]
After you’ve done everything listed on that website, you will probably have to add an exception to windows firewall. Which is as simple as clicking advanced, than new inbound rule.
[/quote]
Thank you. I gave up trying to explain after the portforward.com, which I don’t understand why this is so hard for people -.-[/quote]
Well, imagine yourself on a WoW private server website, you would be the clueless new guy. Nobody just knows how to do things, you just have to work with people until they understand, and when you can’t handle it anymore you take a break so you don’t go berserk on the newbies.

[quote=“Marcuum, post:10, topic:347700”]I already opened the 43594 port on the firewall.

Still doesn’t work.

Icreated, if this isn’t hard, why didn’t you solved my problem yet? Hm…[/quote]
Ill read the router guide and find out what you may have done wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with creating a RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Marcuum Marcuum
item.description:
@Marcuum wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:6, topic:347700”][quote author=Marcuum link=topic=444085.msg3260700#msg3260700 date=1278466803]

Find your router listed somewhere on their site and click on it. It should give you details on how to portforward correctly.

I found it, then I clicked on RSPS, then it told me to add the 43594, I added that, doesn’t work.

So?
[/quote]
Did you follow the directions on the site all the way through? And what router are you using…?[/quote]
I have 2 comps at my house. I’m using a notebook (Kelow), with wireless internet. I tried with using my router, and the thing which gave the internet to the notebook.

Well, I did enter 192.168.1.1 on my adress, pass and user admin, then clicked on Portfowarding, then on Virtual Servers, added what they told me. I’m using DS-Link 220E as router, and TP-Link TL-WR541G/TL-WR512G as the other thing which gaves internet to the notebook…

I gave you a lot of infos.

SO?

Read full topic

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:2, topic:347700”]www.portforward.com may be able to help you.
If not, scan the client.java CLIENT side making sure theres no other spot you need to change the IP to yours.[/quote]

And I checked client.java on the client… Nothing…

All status checkers said my server is off.

TY
